website_summaries.verdict: Add ease to your steering wheel with a spinner that offers a classic look and universal compatibility.
pros: Large steering knob is easy and comfortable to hold during fast or tight turns
Simple black finish blends well with most car interiors
cons: The metal mounting ring is soft and easy to bend out of shape with enough force

customer_reviews.title: Great control!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It feels a little light weight but works great and make turning so much easier. I'm a mail carrier and stop at 700 boxes a day. This gives me great control with 1 hand.
customer_reviews.author: Sondy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic but Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: This knob costs under 10$ and it feels like it. I installed it in my 2010 Silverado. It isn't quite snug enough however I'm sure I can fix that with another piece of rubber. The downside of it is the knob itself. It's hollow plastic and feels super cheap. There's no heft to this product at all. If you're looking for something to use on a vehicle that doesn't get much use, I'm sure it'll work just fine. For your daily drive, I'd spend a bit more money. This one will get thrown in the tool box as soon as I order a nicer one.
customer_reviews.author: JTB

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a spinner wheel to help me drive after shoulder surgery. This one was modestly priced and Prime. It arrived on time and was easy to install. A pad is provided for smaller steering wheels and it made the spinner fit snugly and securely. Installation was easy and fast. A socket wrench works well since you are doing it upside down. It takes practice to get good at using it but it very definitely performs its function well.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: It does not fit all steering wheels
customer_reviews.text: Just to be specific, this spinner is too large even with rubber spacer inserted for my Poulan Lawn Mower's steering wheel. It is too large for my 2011 Toyota Corolla's steering wheel without the adapter. But will fit with the adapter inserted. It is a bit flimsy and loose on the bolt and shaky. Ball seems to be too loose after installation. The included instructions are written by some functional alliterate writer, that mangles the heck out of English, making the instructions difficult to mentally absorb. But if you are a handy man/lady you will be able to figure it out. Overall, it is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Love

customer_reviews.title: I really like it!
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally purchased this one because of the ease of install for our tractors... it is for vehicles and so has a larger band that just fits cars/trucks. TOTALLY my fault! I really loved it but had to get one that was made for tractors. Will keep it as a backup tho. Hubby doesn't use them so I have to switch between tractors and bring my spinner with me. If I liked them in my truck I would be in heaven but I only use spinners in the tractors. I really like that it only has 1 bolt and easy to install/uninstall.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Warren

customer_reviews.title: Do not bother using on Golf Cart, unless read below.
customer_reviews.text: It's now mounted after much trial and help from Internet. Unfortunately not designed for the smaller framed golf cart steering wheel. Continually loosens up. The best fix was given by a former user. Start on the wheel with a folded piece of sandpaper strip folded so the sandy side is on both surfaces. Fill in the rest of the space with strips of rubber tube or water hose , enough to fill the gap between wheel and the handle bracket . Using two open ended wrenches tighten the outer but on handle shaft. The second wrench is to hold the inner nut so that when you tighten the knob will not loose its ability to spin.
customer_reviews.author: eagle

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money or your time
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in packaging with no instructions. Meh. It was pretty obvious how to install it. Before I even went to tighten anything I realized that it’s far too big of an opening to clamp to a mower steering wheel. I was able to sort that out as well. I got it installed nice and snug... or so I thought. It doesn’t lock in place. At all. We have 3 acres and I mow half of that two times a week. I made it about 10 minutes before I took it off. Not only does it twist around the steering wheel, I cut up my knuckles on it. Terrible product. I plan to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Good construction for the price
customer_reviews.text: Well made for the price and parts fit well together. Could use some lubricant from the factory. The clamp is for really thick steering wheels and the provided rubber isn't enough for my application. Two stars off for failing to provide dimensional information on the clamp and making this thing for gargantuan steering wheels. Photo provided to help shoppers with dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Forced to drive left-handed
customer_reviews.text: Because of a shoulder injury I needed to be able to drive left-handed. It takes some getting used to but it appears To be useful. It was easy to install, though doing it one-handed is a challenge
customer_reviews.author: Larry Harper

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING DRIVING TOOL!!!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had so much fun driving in over 15 years (that's what I tell my coworkers)... I drive a Promaster Truck 10 to 12 hours a day. This steering knob makes turning like spreading butter on toast. I wish I would've known about this knob years ago. I appreciate this driving tool so much, I purchased one for my suv. I highly recommend it to everyone who drives a vehicle or truck.
customer_reviews.author: Oso & Gata

customer_reviews.title: Yes, but with modifications.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two one for my tractor and one for my truck (GMC Sierra); the tractor it was to small for the steering wheel so I couldn’t use the cushion that was provided. For the truck it was to big even with the cushion, I ended up using the cushion and wrapping electrical tape round it; however, it does slide so I added carpet tape to the electrical tape to grip both sides. A little bit of modification goes a long way! Other than the modifications the handling of it has been one of the best I’ve ever used. Great for backing up my trailers and implements.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas P Depue

customer_reviews.title: Fit problems
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for two applications. On Kubota tractor, appeared to fit with supplied insert, but repeatedly comes loose and flips over because steering wheel has oval rather than round cross section and clamp does not mold to shape of steering wheel cross section. On older Chevy pick up truck, diameter of steering wheel is far too small for this clamp design to work; mayj try again with multiple pieces of heavy hose as insert. Clamp needs to be redesigned to better fit steering wheel cross sections that are not perfectly round and are smaller than clamp fully tightened.
customer_reviews.author: RTSki

customer_reviews.title: my First
customer_reviews.text: Due to a shoulder injury I required this to drive without pain. I bought the cheapest because I wasn't sure it would help, but it does help with turning, parking etc. The design is such that the hinge is on the side of wheel and it always scrapes my hand while driving.
customer_reviews.author: robin r fox

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I purchase this item helps me park much easier I only use it when I’m parking and when I’m making turns in a small neighborhood block I don’t recommend using it while driving fast or turning while driving fast but aside from that it’s very helpful and easier for me to park my car
customer_reviews.author: mrpablo67

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware ... Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I installed this "premium quality" spinner on my garden tractor steering wheel, which takes very little effort to steer. All told, it had about 3-4 hours use over several days before coming apart. Since a tractor is technically a 'vehicle', I expected better, especially considering the 'premium quality' labeling. I guess I'll just have live with keeping both hands on the wheel and leave the suicide spinner for another sucker.
customer_reviews.author: P. Probst

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You definitely get what you pay for it. This thing is pretty cheap. The handle moves up and down about a quarter inch at least. I had to wrap some hard plastic PVC around my tractors steering wheel to take up the slop. Even with that on there this thing moves all around. Every time you rotate the steering wheel your knuckles scrape against the metal mounting bracket. The handle is just too small to give your knuckles clearance.
customer_reviews.author: Mmiguy2103

customer_reviews.title: Works great and still using it!
customer_reviews.text: I wish, I installed the knob way before my shoulder got really bad. Bought for rotator cuff surgeries. This was the second one. Make sure it fits your stearing wheel. Also buy a temporary cover for leather covered steering wheels. This is to protect your Stearing wheel. You need to tighten it really tight! Make sure you drive drive around your neighborhood before you take a trip. I have it at the ten a clock position. Left arm operated on. Work's great!
customer_reviews.author: NVmike

customer_reviews.title: Mounting bracket inner diameter is just too big
customer_reviews.text: It won't work on my John Deere E130 lawn tractor. The stock steering wheel is too thin for this thing to grip it hard enough so it ends up flopping around which makes it useless. I doubt it would work any better on most other lawn tractors. It could be made to work if you wanted to cut up an old inner tube and place pieces of it inside the mounting bracket. But as delivered it won't work, at least not for me.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Feels like dollar tree item
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cheap as can be. I had to use a bunch of material to get it to work on my tractor and it still feels like it could move. It also is in a way it's not that comfortable, feels flimsy, and cheaply made. It's a handle it should be made better and not cost much. I don't see why anyone would pay more for one but if it's important to you I wouldn't purchase this one it's garbage
customer_reviews.author: justareview

customer_reviews.title: Not a universal fit
customer_reviews.text: Described as "UNIVERSAL FOR ALL STEERING WHEELS - This unit works well in all vehicles including farm equipment. They are great for lawn mowers or lawn tractors. " I have a Kubota tractor and this is way to large. It is past the return date, so I will throw it away and buy one from Kubota.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my riding mower and it works great. It makes turning easier and smoother. I can steer with one hand while adjusting the mower blade height on the "fly." I cut several acres where nothing is flat and roots above ground level so the "anti-scalping" wheels don't always help. It was easy to install and feels very secure at all times. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Bama

customer_reviews.title: Extra help PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother, she loves it. Finds that it helps her a great deal, she broke her hand and this is a lifesaver!! My sister mentioned the ease of putting it on. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: PA

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on my left shoulder so i needed a temporary assist for my truck steering. The product took less than 5 minutes to install and so far I have no complaints. It works so well I may keep it on after my shoulder heals. I rated it a 4 for sturdiness only because after a couple days I had to tighten the retention nut as it slipped slightly but that may have been my fault from the initial installation.
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Not really universal
customer_reviews.text: The universal fit didnt work for the shape on my kubota b2601 steering wheel. I can't really fault the product as it is a universal fit item and universal isn't really true. It works as it should just doesnt fit on my kubota b series tractor.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: ... and four TIA's this knob is one of the best purchases I have made
customer_reviews.text: After having a major stroke and four TIA's this knob is one of the best purchases I have made . I attached it to my lawn tractor steering wheel and what a difference with making my life easyer.Ihad to use electrical tape to beef it up a little to stop a little looseness .
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Conlow

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Sears riding mower, because they said it would fit the mowers steering wheel, well it does not. Not worth the time and effort to return. Also thought it was solid, which it is not.
customer_reviews.author: John Jos. S.

customer_reviews.title: All cars should have one!
customer_reviews.text: I commute 100 miles a day - this is a lifesaver! The installation is simple, but requires a little bit of persistence and strength to get the bolt sufficiently tightened. It can move if you don’t really get it screwed in. Once I fixed that, I haven’t had to make any adjustments. I mount it on the outside of the wheel which allows me to control steering (momentarily) with my knee, when needed. It’s simple to keep the car going straight without veering on the road, and it makes turns SO easy. Everyone should have one of these! Fits well on a Honda CRV
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a ok product, not as sturdy as others but ok for lawn mowers etc. For commercial equipment and big trucks go for a true centered knob with 2 allen head screws on each side. This one sits either to left or right of steering wheel. A True fit sits right on top and centered of the steering wheel. Its in line the normal circumference.
customer_reviews.author: lonestar trucker

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. I bought this for the sole purpose of navigating the "weave" I have to go thru when entering my work facility. Makes it easier to turn when using my large full size long bed truck as well. It doesn't receive 5 stars because it will rotate slightly even with the rubber insert attached.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hageman

customer_reviews.title: Good product, suggest add another rubber spacer
customer_reviews.text: Delivered fast, as described. Did use another rubber strip to tighten on tractor steering wheel as was not tight enough. Only suggestion I have is include 2 rubber spacers, not just one, as all steering wheels vary so anymore, not like used be and needed. Not everyone has access to "fabricate" as some of us do. Good product for application.
customer_reviews.author: Az 506 Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the handle, but it won't fit on my steering wheel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it says "universal", thinking it would absolutely fit my steering wheel. I injured my left hand and needed little help making turns with my car. Universal is not the best term to use to describe this product. The quality seems good, so I will keep for another time.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Nay

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: It is made out of plastic and I saw a picture of one that broke off. It says on the box only use it for slow turning or u turns. That is not for turning at highway speeds, so be careful. Turning is easier but you should practice and be cautious because your car may be more nimble, but it still is like driving a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and sturdy enough to hold up on a garden tractor. Now I look cool mowing the lawn while smoking a cigar!! Seems well made, I love it! **update** After about 6 lawn mowings, the screws that hold the 2 halves together pulled thought the plastic. Had to put bigger washers on and I glued the two halves together, so if it breaks again, it goes in the trash. Minus 2 stars for cheap hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Big Ed, KCMO USA

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT A 1.25 INCH Steering Wheel
customer_reviews.text: I have a Craftsman DYT-4000 Tractor with a 1.25 inch steering wheel and it DOES NOT FIT the steering wheel. I bought this based on two answers below. VERY disappointed. While the knob itself is a decent knob, not great, I do not recommend it for anything 1.25 inches and larger. You would have to re-bend the metal band to make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul TeNyenhuis

customer_reviews.title: Ball is really CHEAP plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good quality on everything but the ball itself which is the cheapest plastic I've ever felt. Amazon tells me I have a month to use the product and return if I'm unhappy. So I'll update my review in a month and see it this things holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Spend 10 more dollars on a better knob.
customer_reviews.text: Was difficult to turn my mower with no power steering. The off set design skinned my knuckles and the thickness of the steering wheel made it difficult to install and keep it from slipping. I have no doubt this works for some applications but for a mower with no power steering, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Jake W

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly adequate for 8$ and super useful!
customer_reviews.text: Dude this thing is great! I haven't even hurt my arm or anything, but I love it anyways! Not only does it make steering your car super easy, but it also makes it SUPER smooth for the passengers, because it gives you much more precistion when steering, so you don't jerk people around as much. Only giving it 4 stars because it's not the most sturdy thing (It's Totally adequate and safe for driving, don't worry) you can kinda jiggle it around and it's not totally sturdy, but it doesn't feel like it'll break or anything, just feels kinda cheap. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: cindy ewald

customer_reviews.title: Product feels and looks extremely cheap
customer_reviews.text: Product feels and looks extremely cheap. It is easy to install but was slightly larger that the diameter of my steering wheel. While I could have just added something to fill the gap and make it more solid, I instead opted to remove it entirely since I did not like the feel or look of this steering wheel knob. I have paid the same amount ($8.75) and even less money for much better quality knobs for my other cars and lawn mowers (get yours at Farm & Fleet or other tractor supply store if you can). Would have returned this one but cost to ship back would have been counter-productive. Not mad, just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Wright

customer_reviews.title: Easy turns for the riding mower
customer_reviews.text: It works as I had hoped for my riding mower. The distance is pretty close between my stomach and the knob when I make full circle turns but that is my fault not the knob, need to lose some pounds. It is a help when you make a lot of turns as I do on my property.
customer_reviews.author: krakowmike

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot. Wish the handle was a bit bigger.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my Husqvarna Yta22v46 lawn tractor. Fit perfectly, didnt need the plastic spacer. Installation was easy enough. Only small complaint is the handle is a bit small for my hands. In my opinion, if it were larger it would be more comfortable for extended use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bricker

customer_reviews.title: Lost grip tension in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my Mahindra tractor. I used the rubber insert to have a good tight fit on the wheel. In less than 30 days it had become loose enough that the rubber insert would continually slip out, and the spinner would be rendered useless as it would just swing freely on the steering wheel.
customer_reviews.author: todd1484

customer_reviews.title: buy "Fouring BL Power Handle Car Steering Wheel Suicide Spinner Knob" instead
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic and there was a loose piece of something inside so it would rattle. I returned this one and got Fouring BL Power Handle Car Steering Wheel Suicide Spinner Knob and am very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Scott Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Not For Lawn Tractor Steering Wheels
customer_reviews.text: Although product description indicates that this will work on a lawn tractor steering wheel, it does not. The only way it possibly could is if the company included thicker or additional spacer(s). Disappointed in the company, product, and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: It’s almost perfect besides the fact that something that easy to install become a pain. At first I thought, wow this is something that you could buy at your local hardware store and make it yourself. my complaint is that it didn’t secure tightly like it should on the first try. it took me a week to finally secure it and that something that happened by accident. But now it works great.
customer_reviews.author: ALEX KONTES

customer_reviews.title: Back in the Driver's Seat!
customer_reviews.text: I shattered my wrist & then got a very serious infection in it after the operation. The infection ate part of the bone away so I'm left with no movement up & down or sideways even after therapy. This knob has gotten me back into my car & driving again. I wasn't able to turn the steering wheel but this knob has made it easy. I don't know the origin of the words "suicide knob" but it's been a life saver for me.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Norquay

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: This knob was very easy to install and reposition as necessary. I find it greatly improves my ability to steer my Deere. I also find it fits comfortably in my hand and I feel less tired when I park the tractor. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too big for lawn tractor
customer_reviews.text: The add says it fits a lawn tractor steering wheel The clamp is too big and can’t be tightened on my husquavarna lawn tractor
customer_reviews.author: rich Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Zento Deals Classic Black Universal Fit Vehicle Steering Wheel Suicide Spinner
customer_reviews.text: Good product and price. I installed this on my riding lawnmower and the rubber is not thick enough to totally secure it to the steering wheel. I would recommend that the rubber come in additional sizes to help secure the knob. All good. works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Housden

customer_reviews.title: Best thing for shoulder surgery!!
customer_reviews.text: This SAVED me after my shoulder surgery. It allowed me to be able to drive safely with one arm. I had full control of the vehicle at all times and could make tight turns easily without sacrificing my shoulder. Best thing ever if you’re having shoulder surgery.
customer_reviews.author: TBear

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap in price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a 2011 E250 I give one star because I have to wrap tape around the steering wheel to make it work. Cracked my knuckle on the metal bracket when turning in the pin that holds the hinge together is sharp. it’s cheap, flimsy and the knob is hollow plastic that might not last long. I only need it to work for A few months until my left hand is functional again.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Timmins

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with functionality of product.
customer_reviews.text: Needed extra rubber to make it fit tight on lawn mower steering wheel. It also does NOT stand up high enough for me. Not enough distance between where it attaches to steering wheel and knob that turns. Uncomfortable trying to hold on top of knob with no room for fingers to grasp on.
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: steering wheel knob
customer_reviews.text: was easy to put on . works seams little wobbly feels like might fall apart i tryed ajusting and making tighter but ? it works i just need get use to. use it on my boat need to turn back and forth fast when docking and it s wavy .
customer_reviews.author: jedma

customer_reviews.title: Plastic,  cheap,  but gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This is the type of steering wheel spinner to use on something like a riding lawn mower.... which I purchased it for. It's a plastic spinner, easy to connect, and does its job. Not made for comfort, Made to turn the wheel easier and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Blunt Honesty.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for price.
customer_reviews.text: The knob seems to work fine. It seems a little loose, but that does not effect the use. I have a wheel cover on my Ford truck steering wheel, so the so the installation required use of vice grips to squeeze the connectors together.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Peters

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty good...but..
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good, comfortable to use in my big truck (my job) and only have a hinge on one side., that's important to me because a shirt etc could catch on the other styles as you turn. Cant risk that in a 80,000 pound truck. Only four stars because they will wear out in a year or so. I tried the 8ball style and the 8ball literally came off in my hand, had to JB weld it on until I got another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Product as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: The steering wheel of the tractor I installed this on was too small circumference-wise for this item to fit "as is" so I added a wrap to the steering wheel and then installed the spinner; it works great and makes mowing acres of pasture much easier!
customer_reviews.author: dave dial

customer_reviews.title: Good steering wheel grip
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time and as described. Price was reasonable . Appears to be good quality & should do the job. I needed to add some additional padding to get a good tight fit as my steering wheel was too narrow
customer_reviews.author: tccchef

customer_reviews.title: doesn't fit a 'standard' fork steering wheel
customer_reviews.text: the bolt is too large to fit the standard hole on our steering wheel. we'll either have to re-tap the hole to get the threading size to work or drill a larger hole that needed and rely on the clamp/bolt to hold it in place. The former is a longer lasting option but requires us to buy a tap.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Works on my tractor
customer_reviews.text: Been meaning to get a "necker knob" for my tractor for several years and finally did. Makes tight turns much easier. It comes with a shim for thinner steering wheels, and I added a second one for mine. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: seadog

customer_reviews.title: helps steer
customer_reviews.text: Since my left shoulder is totally useless due to an old injury this helps me steer thru traffic with ease. Glad these "suicide" knobs are still out there for purchase. This is a very good one, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: If you want to save every dollar then buy this but it might be waste as it is not sturdy. Also the dimension might be small for some cars, as mine have leather covering over the stearing wheel and this comes to be very small for it to hold properly.
customer_reviews.author: abhishake

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful
customer_reviews.text: Nice spinner knob. Does well on my yard switcher. I didn't expect anything spectacular. Just cheap and cheerful. The sturdiness could be improved. But i didn't complain....The knob comes with a very small piece of rubber to put in the clamp when placing on the steering wheel. It didnt help so instead I cut and used some old fabric to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Hakeem

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised but flimsy/light metal fitting
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised BUT, the metal clamp which clamps onto the steering wheel is so light and flimsy that the knob has an inordinate amount of flex in it whenever you apply force to it. I don't expect that the hinge on the clamp will last very long either. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy K

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and worked well for a few weeks. Then the rubber grommet or spacer, whatever they call it, just popped out and was lost in the yard somewhere. Now it just flops around on the steering wheel which makes it a little cumbersome to use.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Letko

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit well
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit well on two steering wheels I tried it on. Additionally, it was very difficult to secure to the steering wheel - needed two tools/wrenches to attempt to tighten but unsuccessful.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Mounts easily to steering wheel
customer_reviews.text: Mounted easily to my steering wheel and works as described. For some reason though, the tractor I mounted it on lives outside, the spinner wants to hold water in it after it rains. The first time I turn the wheel in such circumstance, I always end up with rust water on my legs. Not a huge issue, but worth noting.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolaus Skaer

customer_reviews.title: Does not wrok well on a golf cart steering wheel
customer_reviews.text: As indicated in the title it does not work well on a golf cart steering wheel, but that was a chance I was willing to take based on the price. Overall the product is well made and has simple beauty. Fast delivery and the company seems very interested in feedback to improve their product.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Great working spinner!
customer_reviews.text: I had a tough time finding a wheel knob to fit the padded wheel on my pontoon boat. I found this helped dramatically in tight docking with the elliptical floats which tend to slide. Nice to have adjustable spinner. I added an extra piece of rubber to shim it up tight and its great!
customer_reviews.author: Will Keizer

customer_reviews.title: Put it on the boat
customer_reviews.text: Put it on the ski boat and it sure helps whip the rascals off the tubes and get dirty looks from the wife. But hey, the thing works and it was cheap, two of my favorite things. There is a little play as it is made out of plastic but for the price, I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gundrum

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are simple but confusing
customer_reviews.text: Maybe its because I hand tightened the screw and but, but it comes loose when I am driving. I have yet to find a comfortable place for the knob. I have only my thumb and forefinger on my left hand and am subject to weakness in my right arm and hand. Driving has become difficult which is why I purchased the item. I'm confident that with use I will become confident in the knobs use and be very happy I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic with sharp corners.
customer_reviews.text: Bought after having medical procedure the isolated one of my arms for a few weeks. Low build quality. Pretty unsightly and almost didn't fit around my steering wheel. There are several sharp corners to snag on clothing or other objects. Plastic wheel had pretty bad flashing at the seam.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel DeSloover

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my friend who had sprang both of her hands. This gave her the freedom to drive. It took a minute to understand and to place it properly. She is happy with it😊
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: It worked great once attached with additional padding and tape. It took a few tries to fit this on an enterprise truck steering wheel securely. Once on it was great.
customer_reviews.author: J-Ro

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: This product was bought for an '08 Pontiac vibe. My husband added a washer between the knob and base as he didn't like the knob having too much play in it. Comfortable and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: Good price and it works
customer_reviews.text: Found out they're illegal in California..oops. But I did use it for a couple of full shifts at work and it deserves atleast a 4 star for the price. Like others have said, I'd recommend stuffing extra material to tighten it onto the steering wheel, otherwise it will move.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Simple to Install and Great Quality Steering Knob
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my forklift and one for my truck. Makes turing and operating effortless. The rubber grommet that's included makes it so there's no clamping damage to your steering wheel. The only negative is that there should be a locking rubberized nut included instead of the straight nut. I have to re-tighten the knob every once in a while because of movement. Otherwise a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: KMAGprime

customer_reviews.title: Def does not fit most lawn tractors.
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my John Deere 316. This knob was WAY too big for my tractor. I tried making a shim so that it fits but it doesn't stop the knob from wanting to spin upside down on the steering wheel. If you are buying for a lawn tractor, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Less expensive was better
customer_reviews.text: This went on my husband's pickup. He just had a pacemaker installed and needs to be able to drive one handed. He installed it (practically one handed). Says it went on easily, is firm on wheel and makes driving one handed easy. Looks like a part of the steering wheel. Thanks for a product that works well and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Tight Fit 2017 Toyta Camry SE
customer_reviews.text: It was a very tight fit for my 2017 Toyta Camry Se. It took a lot of man power to get it on. However what we really stood out to me was how fast the handle spins.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel 😃

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I NOW HAVE 2 - ONE FOR WHEN I REST MY ARM NEAR THE WINDOW AND ONE FOR THE ARMREST - EASE OF CONTROL AND MAKES STEERING MORE COMFORTABLE IN MY P-U
customer_reviews.author: Larry O

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my golf cart.... I had to flatten the curvature just a bit to get it to fit, but then added locktite and really cranked down on it. Has held tight ever since. Very very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K

customer_reviews.title: don’t but the cheapest, spend a few more bucks
customer_reviews.text: piece of junk... I had to wrap the steering wheel with electrical tape to increase the diameter... worked ok for about an hour, then it slid around the wheel
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend a few more bucks on something else
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use on a boat steering wheel and it just slid around and did not come with shins or anything and regardless what I tried, I could not keep it from rolling.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Handy Aid
customer_reviews.text: Great solution as a steering aid for one handed operation. With one arm in a sling for a while. I will only need it until my shoulder heals.
customer_reviews.author: MelloPi

customer_reviews.title: Not for mowers
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my zero turn mower’s steering wheel and it just wasn’t up to the task. Much too flimsy for the job. I had a palm grip on the rider before but after several years it broke. I removed this one after ten minutes because it felt like it was going to break. Probably fine for a vehicle with power steering.
customer_reviews.author: joanne

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my craftsman riding mower. It makes life much easier. I'm not nearly as tired when I finish my yard.
customer_reviews.author: primetime

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money on something else.
customer_reviews.text: Granted it's only 9 bucks but considering it's only a couple of nuts, a bolt and a piece of plastic, it could have been better. It is that shiny,cheap, flimsy plastic of cheap kids toys. Despite the "spacer" it was still way too big for my tractor wheel and I had to bed the mount. But it is flimsy as well and didn't hold the bend. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Furst

customer_reviews.title: Works good on riding mower
customer_reviews.text: This is built great. I used it on my riding mower and had to move it from where the original was to fit better, but with the rubber they provided it was a great fit and tightened down nicely
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not enough rubber to snug it up to the wheel
customer_reviews.text: The ball itself works just fine; however it really did NOT fit my Kabota tractor steering wheel. There was not enough rubber to make it tight against the wheel. My husband used some of the rubber from my broken knuckle buster to make it work. I’ve only cut grass once with it, so time will tell if it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Bhonest

customer_reviews.title: Not this one
customer_reviews.text: Total crap, knob was loose and wobbled right from package. Sent it back and bought a way better one at a local retailer for a couple dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should but it’s obvious that it’s made of cheap material. Spend the few extra dollars and get a better one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too cheap of quality
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap quality. Installed this on a 05 Ford f250. It doesn't clamp the steering wheel that well, I had to use more padding. The ones they sell at AutoZone for $12 are much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rahmani

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived on time and as described. The rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and as described. The rubber liner is not thick enough for a lawnmower steering wheel, however my husband was able to cut a few pieces of hose and insert them for the needed thickness. Overall it works as it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get this product to stay in place. It slides around and "dips" under the steering wheel. Ultimately, it's useless. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Makes steering easier
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this on the steering wheel of my Kubota tractor.It's much easier to steer and I can lean back to stretch sore arms and shoulders while still maintaining control.Easy to mount using just the adjustable wrench I keep in the tractor's toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Sid Pits

customer_reviews.title: Spinner feels cheap, but holds strong.
customer_reviews.text: Goes on easy and holds firm- but the actual spinner handle does feel kinda cheap. But it’s still well built and works well. So if you expect a solid heavy duty spinner this isn’t the one for you! But it’s a solid spinner and comfortable to hold onto with a couple fingers. Makes long driving more enjoyable, especially if you work and spend 8 hours in your truck a day.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Coats

customer_reviews.title: Works eith ease
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my JD tractor @ had to add sime rubber spacing for a tight fit, but figured on that & no big deal. Really like it & defines helps.
customer_reviews.author: George Denny

customer_reviews.title: Works on golf cart with modification.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for golf cart. Universal clamp not made for small diameter steering wheel grip. Hard mounted to inner web of wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Neil W. Brabham

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I used it for two hours plowing and they had to remove it and wait till I get home and Loctite the inner not because it was falling apart. And then I miss placed a little rubber spacer and now it doesn’t fit on the steering wheel. I have to find the steering wheel spacer and then it will work again
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Comes loose
customer_reviews.text: Product feels decent enough, and the knob itself works fine. Does not clamp down well, starts off tight and works itself loose *dangerous*. Tightend down with a 1/2 drive 9/16 socket. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Gonzalez

product_meta.title: Zento Deals Classic Black Universal Fit Vehicle Steering Wheel Suicide Spinner Premium Quality Power Handles
feature_bullets: ★ INCREASE TORQUE OF THE STEERING WHEEL - They allow smoother turns especially U-turns, faster parking, safer lane merging and in general handling tight spots. The spinners greatly help when doing difficult car maneuvers. They give you the power and ability to pull of some really tight car moves.

★ UNIVERSAL FOR ALL STEERING WHEELS - This unit works well in all vehicles including farm equipment. They are great for lawn mowers or lawn tractors. It makes the time consuming and tiresome lawn mowing much easier by lessening the turning radius.
★ DURABLE CONSTRUCTION - For years of trouble free use. They are constructed out of premium quality ABS.
★ SMOOTH RETRO LOOK - The classic black color and smooth retro look will enhance your car interior.
★ VERY USEFUL -For beginners or people struggling with arthritis, muscle problems, carpel tunnel syndrome, low muscle tone and the likes. The spinner in general is useful for any car owner.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,826 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
